did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Velvet Underground Collection, 1964-2015.
did.physdesc: Manuscripts, artwork, sound and video recordings, photographs, publications, and ephemera
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The collection contains manuscripts, artwork, sound and video recordings, photographs, publications, and ephemera related to Andy Warhol and the band The Velvet Underground.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: The Velvet Underground was an American rock band, active between 1964 and 1973, formed in New York City.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscripts, artwork, sound and video recordings, photographs, publications, and ephemera. Manuscripts include holographic notes from Lou Reed and Piero Heliczer, as well as several items in the hand of Velvet Underground guitarist Sterling Morrison, including a set list for a performance at Poor Richard's, in Chicago.

Sound recordings in the archive include six acetate demo records of songs by the band c.1966-69; DAT tapes of unreleased material; first pressings, test pressings, and disc jockey editions of Velvets albums; Sterling Morrison's personal copy of the group's fourth album, Loaded; CDs, singles, EPs, and foreign and domestic bootlegs. Photographs include prints of Velvets performances taken by such contemporary photographers as Paul Morrisey, Billy Name, and Adam Ritchie; as well as vintage contact sheets, press and promo photos, and post-2000 prints in black & white and color.

Posters, flyers and other ephemera include advertisements for appearances of Andy Warhol and the Exploding Plastic Inevitable in New York, the Rhode Island School of Design, and the Factory, as well as films by Warhol and posters for Velvets shows in the US, Prague, and elsewhere; flyers and handbills for Velvets appearances. The collection also includes magazines, press clippings, books, and other publications.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Velvet Underground Collection, #8105. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series V. Exhibition and book materials

scopecontent.p: Note written on a folded mailing advertising Piero Heliczers Easter Show at the Bleecker Street Cinema. Reads in full: âdear sterling / hope to have the pleasure /of seeing you / love always / pieroâ

did.unittitle: 2 fliers for "Rites of the Dreamweapon"

scopecontent.p: One is the printed proof with notes in the hand of Angus MacLise. The recto notes revise the information on the flier for MacLise's performances in the New Cinema Festival.

did.unittitle: New Cinema Festival I - Schedule

scopecontent.p: Program from the Film-Makersâ Cinematheque, featuring âRites of the Dreamweapon I: The Tremor Riteâ by Angus MacLise and music by the Velvet Underground.

scopecontent.p: Moe Tucker's copy with her handwriting on front page. Given to attendants at opening of Paraphernalia in March of 1966.

did.unittitle: Handbill for Andy Warholâs Underground New York (film screening with live performance by the Velvet Underground and Nico) at Scott Hall, Rutgers University.
Press release for "The Plastic Inevitable"

scopecontent.p: Typescript flier soliciting performers to participate in âThe Exploding Plastic Inevitable.â Reads in full: âAndy Warhol, The Velvet Underground and Nico / âThe Plastic Inevitableâ / Apply to: The Factory, 231 E. 47th St., New York, N.Y.â Only known copy.

scopecontent.p: The poster uses Roy Lichtenstein's Pop Art Newsweek cover but was not designed by Lichtenstein.

did.unittitle: Postcard handbill for Andy Warhol and his Plastic Inevitable with the Velvet Underground and Nico & the Mothers at the Fillmore Auditorium, San Francisco, CA

scopecontent.p: Set list hand-written in red pen in Sterling Morrisonâs hand on the verso of a page of stationary from Maximâs de Paris, a Chicago restaurant.

scopecontent.p: "âPop Goes the Wedding.â Oak Park, Michigan: New Worlds Inc., Nov. 20, 1966. 5 p. Press release for âthe nationâs first mod wedding ceremonyâ at the Michigan State Fair Grounds/Carnaby Street Fun Festival, Nov. 18-20, 1966."

scopecontent.p: At the Michigan State Fair Grounds

Exhibition and Book Materials

scopecontent.p: This series contains copies of material used in the creation of the book c/o The Velvet Underground, New York, NY or relate to a series of exhibitions of Velvet Underground materials including one at the Boo Hooray Gallery.

"Uptight: The Velvet Underground Story" Typescript Photocopy, with copy of Letter from Gerard Malanga to Sterling Morrison

scopecontent.p: Photocopy of complete typescript of book by Bockris and Malanga, 218 p., plus photocopy of Morrisonâs comments on the text, 57 p. Also included is a photocopy of an original typed cover letter signed by Malanga to Sterl[ing Morrison] dated February 23, 1983, a photocopy of a typed response letter signed by Morrison to Malanga dated Mar. 10, 1983, and 5 photocopied newspaper and magazine clippings.

did.unittitle: New York Public Library Exhibit Labels and Audience Questions

scopecontent.p: Ca. 104 exhibit labels, many with extensive narrative text, from Velvet Underground exhibits curated by Johan Kugelberg at Glenn Horowitz @ John McWhinnie Bookseller, New York (2007) and Hysteric Glamour, Tokyo (2009). 43 manuscript audience questions for Lou Reed, Moe Tucker, and Doug Yule, from the Velvet Underground panel discussion at the New York Public Library, Dec. 8, 2009. âReserved seatâ signs for Lou Reed, Moe Tucker, Doug Yule, and Johan Kugelberg from the Velvet Underground panel discussion at the New York Public Library, Dec. 8, 2009.
